text.p: Standard and Poor's Corp said on Thursday it had lowered its long-term corporate credit rating on ICI Australia Ltd to A-minus from A and placed the rating on creditwatch with negative implications.
S&P said it had also lowered its long-term corporate credit rating on Incitec Ltd, a subsidiary of ICI Australia, to BBB-plus from A-minus.

S&P also lowered ICI Australia's short-term rating to A2 from A1, with the reductions due to the announcement by Imperial Chemical Industries Plc that it planned to sell down its 62.4 percent interest in ICI Australia.

"Standard and Poor's will meet with ICI Australia's management to resolve the CreditWatch and discuss the implication that the change of ownership has for ICI Australia's growth strategy and financial policies, and any impact on management, operational marketing, technical, and research and development links with ICI," it said.
